summary: The 'Reining In Federal Licensing Enforcement Act of 2025' (RIFLE Act of 2025) aims to reform the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms, and Explosives (ATF). The bill introduces graduated penalties for violations by federal firearms licensees, clarifies the definition of "willful" violations, and sets standards for license application denial and revocation. It also addresses the handling of firearms inventory during license expiration or revocation, outlines opportunities to cure violations, and specifies standards for criminal violations of recordkeeping requirements. Furthermore, it contains provisions related to the reconsideration of denied licenses and reimbursement of legal fees in certain ATF cases.
